Detailed Description

An AnimatedTextLine is a drawable object, which contains a text having its own textformat and color. If the text does not fit into the available width of the drawable object, the text starts to scroll.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from TextLine.

enum AnimatedTextLine::Type
 

Enumerator:
Bounce  The text scrolls between the borders.
Cycle  The text scrolls only in one direction.
OnlyOnce  The text scrolls only once in in one direction.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AnimatedTextLine::AnimatedTextLine (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used the animated text line must be initialized by the method Init.

AnimatedTextLine::AnimatedTextLine (  Control *  control,
const WCHAR *  text = 0,
const TextFormat &  text_format = TextFormat(),
Type  anim_type = Cycle,
UINT16  start_delay = 300,
UINT16  anim_speed = 200,
XYDIM  step = 2,
BOOLEAN  auto_start = FALSE
) 
 

Parameters:
control Parent control where the animated text line should be embedded.
text Pointer to the text which should be displayed.
text_format Textformat of the text.
anim_type When the text does not fit into the available width, a scrolling is started. The kind of scroll animation is defined by the anim_type.
start_delay Delay in milliseconds until the scrolling of the text starts.
anim_speed Delay in milliseconds until the next scroll step is done.
step Number of pixels which are used to move the text to the next scroll position.
auto_start If set to TRUE, the animation is started automatically as soon as the text does not fit into the available width.

AnimatedTextLine::~AnimatedTextLine (   )  [virtual]

Returns the horizontal offset in pixels from the animation.

XYDIM AnimatedTextLine::GetStep (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the number of pixels which are used to move the text to the next scroll position.

XYDIM AnimatedTextLine::GetTextGap (   )  const
 

Returns the gap in pixels which is used for displaying the animated text from the right if it the original text disappears on the left.

Type AnimatedTextLine::GetType (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the type of the animation: Bounce, Cycle or OnlyOnce.

Reimplemented from AbstractTextObject.

void AnimatedTextLine::Start (   ) 
 

Starts the animation immediately if the text does not fit in the current line. If the line is wide enough, the started flag is set, but the animation timer is not started. The timer (and hence the animation) is started as soon as the line is not wide enough any more (e. g. if the textline or its parent component is resized).

void AnimatedTextLine::Stop (   ) 
 

Stops the animation.
